page.title: 02PLUMSTEAD/ABBEY WOOD AREA 2
page.content:
Although predominantly residential the area has always been important for public open spaces. At the beginning of century trains, and later, trams brought people from urban Woolwich to the "countryside" of Abbey Wood. Today one can still walk almost the complete width of the area through parks and woodland.
A light industrial area was opened on the Abbey Wood Estate in the sixties but with the current economic recession most units are empty.
The people of the area are also varied. White working class families are in the majority but there is a large Asian population (especially Plumstead) and Abbey Wood has the largest Gypsy Traveller site in Britain.
